title: Celtics reportedly exercise team option for 2024 1st-round pick Baylor Scheierman
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Celtics exercise $2.74 million team option for Baylor Scheierman, keeping him through 2026-2027 season.
Scheierman, 2024's 30th NBA Draft pick from Creighton, averaged 18.5 points per game as a senior.
Scheierman averages 8.5 minutes per game for Celtics, contributing with passing and hustle in limited role.

title: Keion White admits he wasn’t fit for Patriots’ scheme, while 49ers want to tap into ‘limitless potential’
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Keion White was traded from the New England Patriots to the San Francisco 49ers for a sixth-round pick.
White admitted he wasn't suited to the Patriots' scheme and played minimally, recording six tackles and no sacks this year.
49ers view White as having limitless potential, expecting him to fit well into their defensive strategy, according to GM John Lynch.

title: Save money during New England travel in November
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Bluebird Talta Lodge in Stowe offers a Black Friday discount through Nov. 28-Dec. 1, up to 25% off stays.
MBTA bus routes 23, 28, and 29 in Boston are fare free until Feb. 28, 2026, serving key neighborhoods.
Veterans receive free admission at Massachusetts Trustees of Reservations properties and discounted View Boston entry Nov. 8-11.

title: On the Cape and Islands, a new housing fix is gaining traction
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Cape and Island leaders propose luxury home sales fees to fund affordable housing for local workers.
Proposed real estate transfer fees aim to address the housing crisis but face opposition from real estate groups.
Nantucket and Martha's Vineyard seek legislative backing for transfer fees to meet housing needs amid high prices.

title: Meet the vampire who went viral during a visit to Salem
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Long Island cosplayer Matthew Pruno went viral after photos of him as a vampire circulated on a Salem Facebook group.
Pruno's social media following grew by 15,000 after his Salem visit, captivated by his costume and persona.
Pruno embraces his love for cosplay and Halloween despite initial judgment, often portraying Louis from 'Interview with a Vampire'.

title: Boston history quiz: How much do you remember from the past 30 years?
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Boston.com celebrates its 30th anniversary by testing knowledge of key events since 1995.
The interactive quiz invites participants to order major Boston events correctly.
Kelly Chan created the quiz to engage readers and gather feedback on their memory of Boston history.

title: New on Netflix and more: Top streaming picks for November 2025
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Netflix adds 'Back to the Future,' 'Frances Ha,' and 'Game Night' on November 1, 2025.
'Hocus Pocus' and 'The Witch' are recommended Massachusetts-themed Halloween movies to stream this season.
New York City's backdrop features in recent TV shows, including the 'Sabrina the Teenage Witch' sitcom.

title: Pariots RB Rhamondre Stevenson to miss Sunday’s game vs. Falcons
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Rhamondre Stevenson will miss Sunday's game against the Falcons due to a toe injury, as confirmed by Mike Vrabel.
Patriots plan to promote one of three running backs from the practice squad to fill Stevenson's absence on Sunday.
TreVeyon Henderson expected to lead the Patriots' backfield with Terrell Jennings serving as the second option.

title: NFL execs believe Patriots are for real, but are a year away from Super Bowl contention
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots quarterback Drake Maye and coach Mike Vrabel lead the team to a 6-2 start, raising playoff hopes.
NFL executives express doubts about Patriots' immediate Super Bowl potential, praising Maye and the offensive improvements.
Maye earns MVP buzz with top-five passing metrics; Patriots have 12th-best Super Bowl odds according to DraftKings.

title: Before Election Day, meet Boston’s City Council candidates
author: Madison Lucchesi and Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Boston's municipal general election is on November 4, with polls open from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m.
Eight candidates are competing for four at-large seats on Boston's City Council in the upcoming election.
Mayor Michelle Wu is running unopposed, while candidates for district-specific seats vary per district.
